website_summaries.verdict: Boasts three-inch wheels with high-quality metal casters to easily accommodate larger tripods.
pros: Trustworthy brand provides a lifetime warranty
Legs are easy to adjust, ensuring you can find just the right angle on the scene
Comes at a lower price point than you might expect
Transportable unit folds and includes a carrying bag
cons: Requires a smooth and hard surface to deliver the best results

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: My first tripod dolly, so I cant compare it with others, but it did its job at a quinceañera party. Very smooth and quiet. I have 2 video tripods, and even tho they are professional grade, the legs are so long that they wobble a little bit. The dolly ads structural stability. It's easy to put together, easy to put away, fits perfectly in its bag. It seems sturdy. If anything happens, I will update this review. I never throw or bit up my equipment. I try to be as gentle as I am with my cameras. This my fourth Ravelli product and so far I am very happy everything.
customer_reviews.author: humdec

customer_reviews.title: Hard plastic wheels? Come on, guys
customer_reviews.text: Meh. It's a cool idea, but getting the tripod into the legs takes some time and effort, and if you aren't on a really smooth surface, it bumps and shakes a lot. These guys really should have considered using soft rubber wheels instead of hard plastic ones—duh—videographers aren't always filming on perfectly smooth, level ground :/ Oh, and like that shopping cart at the grocery store that seems to go wherever it wants, this dolly kind of does it every so often. If you are shooting on smooth floors and you have some time to make certain the wheels are perfectly aligned before you start your camera move, it's not a bad rig.
customer_reviews.author: InArizona

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth having !!
customer_reviews.text: This Tripod Dolly was a life saver today. The charity I volunteer at held a volunteer at asked for me to shoot some video today. This dolly made it very easy to move my Manfrotto tripod with amounted on it. I left the back half of the Neewer rig attached and had mymounted on it. I was able to easily and quickly move the entire setup to another location. This made it a lot easier to do some walking shots that I wouldnt have been able to otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: TechBytes with Ron NutterTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Good Value for the Money
customer_reviews.text: Well constructed and sturdy. Rolls very smoothly. Looks nice. Using it on a heavy Manfrotto tripod in our commercial studio. The tripod will, most likely, never be taken off this unit. Bag is cheap and I wouldn't expect it to hold up to any sort of travel, but at this price point, nobody should be seriously expecting a decent carrying case. I was a little worried given some of the negative reviews but it appears that those are from that small percentage of buyers who just aren't going to be happy no matter what.
customer_reviews.author: Jesus Built My Hotrod

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Ravelli Tripod dolly a bit ago and used it 3 times before it had an issue with one of the arms of the dolly. It has a button release in the arm and would not stay connected. I did like it. Substantial rubber wheels that gave my camera a smooth ride for tracking shots etc. Locks down on each wheel, good equipment for the price. Had to duct tape the arm on to the hub and not rely on it as a main dolly. I did mention this in a post. Customer service has sent a new one and looking forward to working with this equipment, appreciate the follow through! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Stone

customer_reviews.title: Excellent rugged and strong
customer_reviews.text: I have a heavy duty tripod TV stand for using a 33" TV in front of a treadmill and home gym. The stand ( is excellent, but circumstances change, and now I needed to be able move it around a bit. Casters just don't come large enough for the 1.5" diameter tripod legs, so I looked at this. Perfect. The design will accommodate a large range of sizes and leg diameters. Very secure and it rolls nicely without damaging the hardwood floor. The locks in our case are unnecessary, but they work and easily. The carrying case is a nice touch, but again for our application, not necessary. However we always can use another tripod bag.
customer_reviews.author: WilliamBTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Worthy addition to my video/film kit
customer_reviews.text: Used it for one shoot, and frankly, it was worth the purchase price just for the killer following shot I was able to get. No, it's not a track dolly, and it's not a 3 axis gimbal. Yes, you need really smooth surfaces to roll on if you want to eliminate any & all camera shake. But in today's world of solo-produced content, this is an amazing hack for battery-free follow-cam footage. I can't imagine going back!
customer_reviews.author: mineyourbiz

customer_reviews.title: Inspect your package-it could be a return!
customer_reviews.text: One peice was defective- was impossible to contact the seller or manufacturer. Had to do a return and order another. The new one I ordered was CLEARLY a return, also and re-sold- it had dents & scratches. The original seal on package was opened and they re-sealed it with packing tape and sold it to me. I ended up taking the part I needed and putting my defective part into the box they sold me that was used. I really like the dolly, especially for the price- but not happy about customer service and being sold a returned product.
customer_reviews.author: PowerBuyer

customer_reviews.title: Great price for a stable and secure tripod dolly!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for use in an equipment demo room for remote WebEx and Hangouts to demonstrate equipment. I have a tripod that is very sturdy and this connected with ease and has provided a secure mount. The dolly does transmit any imperfections in the floor but the room I am using it in is carpeted and has a concrete slab below that so the video is very smooth. In addition, the latency of the remote connections essentially ignores any small bumps so this is not an issue for my application. The dolly is very light and stable and has allowed me to focus on my presentations without worrying about dragging the tripod around. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: FloriDave

customer_reviews.title: Alright for the Price - But the Wheels Flip Around
customer_reviews.text: I love that you can fit any tripod on here and it even holds a fair amount of wait. But the wheels are so problematic. For the price, I'm going to overlook it and still use this. But this is just a warning to all future buyers - the wheels will flip around when you change directions, causing a noticeable jump in the steady movement. Moving one direction it works fine and looks smooth for me. If there is any shake, it can be easily softened with a stabilize effect. But any slight change in movement causes the wheels to flip and it affects the footage greatly.
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlin N. Larson

customer_reviews.title: THIS TRIPOD DOLLY IS NOW IN MY MUST HAVE GEAR BAG
customer_reviews.text: Under $40, nice case, free lens cleaner, free led clip on flashlight, smooth like butter, wheels lock & unlock perfectly. Wheels are high quality, roll super smooth and swivel effortlessly. Don't hesitate, great value and nice to have in your gear bag. I use it for all my indoor work. Looking to get a second one. Take a tip from Snooch, use a couple of sand bags or ankle weights to make this super smooth! <<<<<<MY FREE LED FLASHLIGHT WAS ALMOST DEAD ON ARRIVAL, IT DOES LIGHT BUT VERY DIM.>>>>>>> It's not a deal breaker and I didn't buy the dolly for the flashlight, but if they include it I think it should work.
customer_reviews.author: SNOOCH

customer_reviews.title: Ravelli ATD Tripod Dolly Wins My Approval!!
customer_reviews.text: This suits my needs very well especially when video taping!! You can lock one wheel and move or pan the tripod without having to pan with the handle on the tripod. When you want to steady the shot (video-taping) all three wheels can be locked!! No shake or vibration will occur unless you disturb the action of the video camera or Digital Single Lens Reflex Camera (also known as DSLR). I recommend this to anyone who needs a sturdy Tripod Dolly!1
customer_reviews.author: Mister Bear

customer_reviews.title: Nicely Made, Rolls Well, Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so I can roll around my video camera on its tripod. It is well built, easy to assemble, folds nicely, comes with a carrying case that will hold it without having to take it apart, and when you get the tripod in it, it rolls around great. I'm sure there are probably units out there with better casters, but for me this one is just fine. A very good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: T. Mills

customer_reviews.title: It’s not unstable to record as I would need/like.
customer_reviews.text: If you want record a video while moving the camera, probably you will have problem. It will not move with stability. I tried on a carpet and it wasn’t smooth. If you only want it to move easily your stuff from one place to another one while not recording, it will work great!
customer_reviews.author: hpm

customer_reviews.title: Good and solid. Great buy for the price
customer_reviews.text: Very stable and solid! Fits perfectly with Ravelli tripod of similar model. However for smooth starting movement you must make sure the wheels are already rotated to the direction of travel. {UPDATE:} I was contacted buy SPN Performance (seller) regarding my issues with the wheel rotation on the tripod dolly and I must say: BEST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER! It is nice to finally have a company that has an active role in customer satisfaction as opposed to responsive . SPN made sure to clarify exactly what my issue was and took the time to make sure I was 100% satisfied. And I am now indeed 100% satisfied. I will be Looking to SPN first when I seek out new equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Sparkytastic

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty Good Design
customer_reviews.text: For the money this is higher quality than expected. Obviously engineered by someone intelligent. Heavy, rigid, no apparent deficiencies or weak design points, even where there is plastic. The wheels are rubberish and roll smooth, and I actually feel my tripod is as balanced and sturdy on the wheels as it is off the wheels....maybe even more since there is now no chance of tripod slipping open or tipping with a bump. Also the wheels lock and make little to no noise in case you want to wheel this thing for a moving shoot. Put simply, this is a purchase you wont at any point regret. Buy and move along to the next accessory.
customer_reviews.author: Mel O

customer_reviews.title: Love It...
customer_reviews.text: Love it Love it Love it!!! I don't currently have a zoom lens for my rigs, and this allows me to connect my Ravelli tripod, or any tripod for that matter and get some great movement in my shots and even allow me to mimmick a zoom without actually having to have a zoom lens...Good stuff!!!
customer_reviews.author: Cnote

customer_reviews.title: Not excellent but almost.......
customer_reviews.text: Great tripod.....only think......the wheels could be softer. On tile,recording every little bump sound.
customer_reviews.author: E.I.G.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing studio-quality wheels!
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant... The wheels on this device are top notch! So smooth and stable! I'm using it with a portable tripod but I also tried it with a heavy duty, not-so-portable, studio tripod and it adjusted to fit that as well. I'll be purchasing another one for my other tripod.
customer_reviews.author: Siren

customer_reviews.title: Picked up this inexpensive dolly for easily moving my camera into position in floored locations
customer_reviews.text: Picked up this inexpensive dolly for easily moving my camera into position in floored locations. It is a bargain for the price. Wheels are smooth and the locking mechanisms are secure. I use it with a 11 lb Sony 4K rig and an 18 lb JVC HD rig with heavy Manfrotto tripods. I shoot in many controlled environments with flat surfaces. I am considering picking up 3 more for easy movement for various lighting instruments on stands in basic 3 point lighting setups that I use often. Great product at a great price!
customer_reviews.author: jcommstudios

customer_reviews.title: and i LOVE IT! i shot my first wedding the other ...
customer_reviews.text: Life saver, i wasn't sure about this and if i'd need it, but really did need it , and i LOVE IT ! i shot my first wedding the other day since purchasing it, and it was great moving back and forth during a reception portion of the wedding,normally i have to mount the camera on my shoulder, and my back is killing me after awhile. The tripod fit perfect on it, and it was very easy to lock/unlock the wheels and adjust the spacing for the tripod, its very sturdy, looks very professional, i have no complaints, if you need mobility for shooting video with ease, i definitely recommend this, and the price was great for what you get.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Great for my Matterport Camera
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this with my Matterport camera for large commercial spaces and it has cut down on my time drastically, well made except for the little pins that lock the legs in place(they still will stay in place but I think the design was to just make it more secure, there is a little plastic nub that broke off the day I got it but it wasn’t a big deal) over all I would recommend this
customer_reviews.author: G. Boscamp

customer_reviews.title: DON’T GET THIS - LOOK AROUND
customer_reviews.text: Not as durable as I need for my photo booth. Shame, as it wasn’t the cheapest option available. I have two of these, and they don’t lock open from almost the beginning, which makes mounting the tripod more difficult.
customer_reviews.author: EXCLUSIVE SHOPPER

customer_reviews.title: Universal Product.
customer_reviews.text: Delivered two days earlier (Kuwait)... The mid section looks little fragile... Ravelli should consider to add a small foldable leg underneath the mid section to support unexpected pressure. Happy about this universal product. Planing to order another two of this compact Dolly along with the Ravelli AVTP 75 mm Tripod... worth the money. Happy about their products and the customer service is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Daris

customer_reviews.title: Working fine
customer_reviews.text: I received this with no issues. I have now used it on several occasions to shoot video. It has worked well though I've only used this on smooth indoor flooring. I do hope to use this outdoors though in areas with sidewalks etc, though I think this would work on hard ground/grass that was firm. It rolls smoothly. It seems to be built well...haven't noticed any 'stress' connections as of yet. I think with decent care and attention it should last me a good while.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, Quality Build, Smooth Rubber Wheels Produce Smooth Shots
customer_reviews.text: This makes moving shots with a tripod a breeze. One of my favorite parts of this (besides it's sturdiness and quality build) is the rubber, smooth wheels, which produces smooth shots even when rolling across not so perfect ground. I bought 2 of them, for both of my tripods. I use them constantly. This thing is the real deal. Made with all quality parts, and comes with a handy carrying case with a strap to carry it on your shoulder. It's pretty light, so it wouldn't be difficult at all to travel distances with it around your shoulder. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: David DeuceTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: No good grip, very shaky unless you have a perfect floor.
customer_reviews.text: Great at what it does under very strict conditions. You need an absolutely seamless and clean flat floor. The tripod needs to be thick and rubbery or else it slides right off. Very not trustworthy. Works for one of my tripods that is padded with rubber feet but others it's awful.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Ayala

customer_reviews.title: Am very satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a dolly for my camcorder for some time. I have a limp, which has made some of my past videos that I have posted on YouTube look a little weird, even with their ability to reduce shaking in videos. The smoothness of my current videos is a vast improvement. It is nice to be able to wheel my camcorder around, instead of carrying it. I have to readjust my stride length a little, so as not to bump the dolly, but I can already see a vast improvement from the first time that I have used my Ravelli. Overall- am quite quite pleased wit it. Very smooth rolling really helps out a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Buzz1954

customer_reviews.title: High Quality and heavy duty.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome item to hold my flashes follow quick mobility allowing me to move my flashes easily and quickly! Heavy duty quality. Fantastic price! I already own two of their camera stands which are AMAZING!
customer_reviews.author: Derrick F.

customer_reviews.title: Reccomended Photo Accessory
customer_reviews.text: Ravelli Tripod Dolly is a great choice and a worthwhile camera accessory. I've held off for much too long before purchasing this dolly. I use a tripod often and simply got tired of picking up my camera and speedlite laden tripod to reposition it again and again. The dolly moves about freely even over carpet. Each wheel is lockable. The lock mounts for your tripod's feet are easily adjustable to match the tripod's spread. The dolly folds up for easy transport in the included travel bag. It is a little fiddly to get the dolly into the bag snug enough to zipper it closed. But that's a minor annoyance. Give it a try.
customer_reviews.author: CharlesB

customer_reviews.title: Great for tripods and light stands at trade shows - well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This is a lightweight dolly perfect for quick mobilization at trade shows. Not quite as rugged as we would like but time will tell how it holds up compared to much more expensive units we have
customer_reviews.author: Richard J. Depaso

customer_reviews.title: Great Dolly!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent tripod. I was very surprised at the quality of this dolly. Solid construction all the way around, all metal (except for the cradle the tripod's feet fit into and the thumb screws). As long as you don't abuse this thing, it'll server you well. I've put Manfrotto's on it as well as lower-end tripods and this thing is very strong. Quiet wheels, sturdy and very easy to use. Spring loaded, pull tabs make breaking down the dolly a snap. The bag is is pretty decent too, although I'd be really careful with zipping this thing up. The moment you start treating the zipper like it's a $100 roadie bag, you'll find yourself picking the zipper-pull off the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Monterio Weaver

customer_reviews.title: Great Tripod Dolly That Rolls Smooth And Adjusts To Almost Any Situation
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love, love, love. Bang for the buck pretty darn hard to beat. The wheel locks are a bit picky, wish I could use them with my toe but bending down to lock/unlock is no big deal. Quality is good, and the large wheels roll very smoothly. This isn't a substitute for a rail system but with minimal practice on a smooth surface you can get some gorgeous rolling shots. Also makes shooting a lot easier if you have a fixed subject and you're changing camera angles (like in video production) in rapid succession.
customer_reviews.author: David H. Obelcz

customer_reviews.title: Waste Of Money. Do Not Buy.
customer_reviews.text: Even though the build material might make it feel a little heavy, this product is useless (unless your buying it to leave it in your closet). It does not serve it’s purpose at all without having a smooth floor whatever the material is. If bumpy or not smooth, it will catch all vibrations making your footage worthless. Invest on a good tripod & a slider, or a gimbal if you have the money.
customer_reviews.author: Sohaim

customer_reviews.title: Not the Dolly used by Ridley Scott but I am no Ridley Scott
customer_reviews.text: I don't do movies, so I can't really judge whether this would be stable enough. I do still photography and this dolly works just fine to move an loaded tripod around. Loaded with camera and all, and also a pair of sandbags to ensure its stability, although I am very confident with it. Essentially when shooting in the studio and needing to have the camera on tripod, this is very handy. Only caveat: if you use a tripod with independent legs, you want to set their length so that they are all at a known, locked angle otherwise the center column may not be vertical. Not a problem for me.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Perdu

customer_reviews.title: Durable tripod or light stand wheels
customer_reviews.text: I love using these with my tripod and or light stands. It makes moving them around so much easier ! They are rugged and durable and glide across many different surfaces effortlessly !
customer_reviews.author: M. C.

customer_reviews.title: Well Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Very well made but light duty. Like other reviewers have said... don't try to stand on it! the weight at the corners where the tripod mounts will take a considerable amount of weight though. I was disappointed in the spread though. My tripod was barely half open. I would have preferred another 12" to the diameter. Still, it does hold the tripod up but it is slightly tippy if a wheel catches on something so I suggest you use weight bags on your tripod. The wheels roll smoothly and the wheel locks are the best I have ever seen! Since I know the price of wheels, just the wheels alone are worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Good addition to the Ravelli video tripod
customer_reviews.text: A little expensive for what you get (it's a set of locking rollers on extendable legs), but works as described. Works especially well with the matching Ravelli tripod with fluid head. UPDATE: The seller, SPN Performance, contacted me via phone twice and email once after I left a four-star review (instead of a five-star review). They credited me $8 and asked me to change the review. I'll increase the review to a five-star review because the tripod dolly is now even a better value considering their refund offer, and the Seller's customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Willie V. HughesTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Well made. Good value
customer_reviews.text: I am using this with my heavy duty Manfrotto carbon fiber tripod and video rig. For a budget dolly this unit is well built and functions well. However, I do NOT intend to use this dolly for "dolly shots". Although you might be able to get away with a dolly shot if you added some stabilization in post, the real value of this unit is to be ably to reposition a heavy camera between shots.It does that very well. This unit is very quick to set up and the storage bag is a nice addition.
customer_reviews.author: Richard CastilloTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointed but still usable
customer_reviews.text: Overall the design isn't bad, but I have a lot of issues with mine. It came pre-scratched in several places. One of the screws that holds the sliding bracket into the leg is bent and the strap on the case is so short, there's no reason to even have it on there. I'm in a wheelchair and needed the strap to carry it, so that's a huge problem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality product
customer_reviews.text: Great product, and a company to buy from. Ravelli stands behind every aspect of their product. While the delivery, packaging, and product quality was 5-star, I had a concern that since the wide stance of my light stands was wider than their dolly would allow, I thought it my be a little unstable when using a light/reflector boom. Within a day of seeing my online review, their team had me all taken care of. They worked with me on finding just the right solution in a fast, courteous, and professional manner. This company values happy customers. They won't stop serving until you love their products. Great quality, great customer service. I'll be back.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Vanbergen

customer_reviews.title: Eh, it's okay
customer_reviews.text: I used it twice and on the second time one of the wheels got bent somehow. I have no idea how and now its basically useless. If you don't use it on completely smooth flooring it will not work, and if the wheels are even slightly bent it will throw the entire thing off. Even the first time right out of the packaging it is hard to smoothly roll across flooring because the wheels are like shopping cart wheels in that they swivel a lot, so you have to set them up all pointing in the same direction before you attempt to make even the simplest dolly shot.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Bang for your Buck: Updated 12.5.18
customer_reviews.text: Great Dolly, You definitely get the Bang for your buck..The only minor glitch in the Matrix is you can feel every bump on a concrete surface pr surface with big cracks.. If the floor is smooth OMG, you will be in heaven. One episode of West Los Scandelous, The Dolly felt so good to me I overused it. I was gliding across the floor like Jimmy Slyde. I truly Enjoy it. I recommend that you buy this product.
customer_reviews.author: Ashton Bleu

customer_reviews.title: This fits the Amazon basics tripod
customer_reviews.text: Really excited to use this product, it turns your rig into a dolly for a very small price. It folds down when not in use and can be used, the only thing I would say to make it better would be to make it heavier so it is stronger, but for the price this is a steal.
customer_reviews.author: Teddy

customer_reviews.title: Overall a good, lightweight product
customer_reviews.text: This dolly is great except for the metal push pins that hold the wheel assemblies in place. They have plastic tips and the plastic is the only part that extends into the wheel assemblies. SPN, the vendor, was fantastic to deal with. Definitely dedicated to customer satisfaction.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Wheels are too small
customer_reviews.text: Not very stable at all on anything but hardwood. This is EXTREMELY light weight. It is not at all stable on thin office carpet without any pad. I am disappointed in this. The wheels are too small to be effective. I had high hopes but I am let down is the overall quality of the product. Everything is very cheap on it.
customer_reviews.author: el_handsome

customer_reviews.title: Love this product great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Perfect very easy to use I just wish the lock system was little more easy to use or more softer but for the price it’s a great product
customer_reviews.author: akhtarun bhuiyan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent upgrade to your Tripod
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent upgrade to your tripod. I happen to be using this with a Ravelli tripod, and it works very well. While some might complain about the shots you get is using it on a tile or rough floor, it works great on a bare flow for excellent shots. It also makes it much easier when you are just moving equipment around. For the money, this is a nice piece of equipment that will give you great flexibility in your camera work.
customer_reviews.author: RicoTX

customer_reviews.title: Best Addition to Any Photo Video Studio
customer_reviews.text: When setting up a photo / Video Studio, you are always looking for ways to make your shoot more professional! These Tripod dolly wheels are one of my absolute favorite additions to our studio and I would recommend them to anyone looking for the same. the price is not overboard and the quality even holds our heavy boom, so it is wonderful quality. Haley Fox @WITHLOVEFROMHALEY
customer_reviews.author: Haley Fox Blog

customer_reviews.title: Happy Customer
customer_reviews.text: I really like this tripod dolly. Unfortunately, one of the adjustment screw broke from the knob while the tripod was attached, and it was very difficult to unscrew. I would recommend the product but with a notation regarding the screws. UPDATE!!! I decided to give this Tripod Dolly another try, and I am very glad that is did. The second one works very well. In addition, my purchase was made at SPN Performance who has very good customer service policy.
customer_reviews.author: Ria

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!!!!!  BUY IT!
customer_reviews.text: This dolly is the perfect companion to my Ravelli AVTP tripod, but is fully adjustable and will fit most sticks. The quality is solid, and the dolly glides easily across carpeted and solid surfaces. The wheel locks are sturdy and a breeze to operate, and if you lock just one wheel, you can effortlessly pan in a full or partial perfect circle. The canvas travel bag is sturdy and easy to carry. This unit is great for moving my DSLR video rig, and is the least expensive and best built unit on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Ray Fowler

customer_reviews.title: great value, good product but could use some upgrades.
customer_reviews.text: I love this little dolly. It rolls smoothly and easily. The only thing I wish it had was a handle to push/pull the dolly to make a smoother operation, but as long as you know how to handle your tripod smoothly you can figure out how to make this dolly work. I like the fact that you can lock a wheel down to do a 360 pan, (not a large circle mind you) but again, doing a smooth circular pan without a handle takes some work. Overall, I like the product and adds style to my kit.
customer_reviews.author: Rob53

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a dependable, sturdy set of wheels for your tripod look no further! These wheels are compact, light weight, yet sturdy. I have a pretty large set of Bogens and these work perfectly! They glide well against any floor type. I've even had to use them on carpet. The price is right, the quality is excellent! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Gentner

customer_reviews.title: Great Company
customer_reviews.text: I had one little snag on a part that broke soon after receiving it. A small little plastic piece that keeps the size adjuster from moving. I reported it and offered to return it for repair; and they just sent a new one. I asked if they wanted the old one back to do a refurbished sale and they said no. Like who does that?
customer_reviews.author: tina quayle

customer_reviews.title: Why would this company make such a great item, THEN decide to make the locking pin ...
customer_reviews.text: Why would this company make such a great item, THEN decide to make the locking pin out of shear plastic that BREAKS the first moment you take it out the box? You've planned to skimp on a metal pin? That's why I'm giving it the one star rating! Order the Pangshi model! The wheels are smaller, but its more durable than this!
customer_reviews.author: Montgomery A. Slue

customer_reviews.title: WAY better than expected for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have not yet taken this dolly out for photography use, but when I opened the package I was impressed with the build quality. All ball-bearing casters, with all 3 of them having separate brake pedals. Even the carrying case is actually of pretty good quality. The item was a little heavier and more well-built than I expected. All in all it appears that this is a very good deal for the money, compared to all of the other entry-level china-type photography stuff that I have purchased as I have gotten my photography career going. product_meta.title: Ravelli ATD Tripod Dolly for Camera Photo Lighting
product_meta.description:
The Ravelli ATD Tripod Dolly is designed to allow rolling movement of your tripod or light stand from one location to another without lifting. It uses large rubber surfaced wheels. The 3” wheels are lockable with step function locking. On each leg of the dolly are sliding adjustable foot locks for your tripod or stand. The dolly is collapsible and has a carry handle and a carry bag. The legs disassemble into two sections for shorter storage if desired. Each dolly leg is 16” long allowing for a maximum diameter spread of 36”.

The larger rubber wheels with ball bearings do allow for relatively smooth rolling motion. However, this may not be sufficient for truly zero jitter video. Actual results will vary based on the smoothness of the ground surface and the presence of any dirt or debris.

If you are looking for ultra smooth video, possibly better options would be a mounted glider/slider on the top of the tripod or a floor mounted track system.
feature_bullets: Metal Ball Bearing Casters with 3” Rubber Wheels and Step Function Locking
Sliding Adjustable Leg Locks with Maximum Diameter spread of 36”
Folding Design with Adjustable Length Legs and Carry Handle and Carry Bag
Allows for Relatively Smooth Rolling Movement but Not Jitter Fee Video Movement
